channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: How buyers are winning bidding wars in a market where homes are going for $620,000 over ask
item.description: The spring home-buying season could be bruising in this region, where bidding wars are alive and well.

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek
item.description: U.S. stocks were mostly lower, with the Nasdaq leading declines as makers of AI infrastructure suffered steep falls, many in the double digits. Nvidia...

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat
item.description: Arabica coffee prices hit a record level, as traders digested the withdrawal of President Trump’s threats to impose tariffs and economic sanctions on ...

item.title: ‘I’m deeply disturbed’: My portfolio lost 20%. With Trump’s trade war, do I sell my stocks and buy gold?
item.description: “With the current state of domestic and global affairs, I’m at a loss as to how to keep my economic stability in check.”

item.title: My husband plans to leave his entire estate to his adult son, who steals his credit card to gamble online. What can I do?
item.description: “Dementia runs in my husband’s family. My husband’s son has been known to take money from his dad without permission.”

item.title: America’s job market is eerily similar to the 1990s dot-com boom. Should we be worried?
item.description: March 20 marks the 25th anniversary of the dot-com bust. Could it happen again?

item.title: I fled our $2.2 million home due to domestic abuse. I’m the only one on the loan, but my husband won’t sell. What now?
item.description: “He contributed a $1 million down payment. I mortgaged the rest in my name.”
